name: Clin T GIST Esophagus
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM does not include an in situ category for GIST esophagus tumors.

**Note 2:**  Ignore intraluminal extension to adjacent segment(s) of colon; code depth of invasion or extra-appendiceal spread as indicated.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign T. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record.
* If no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 4:** Assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size for the following descriptions:

    Tumor confined to muscular wall
    Tumor invades through submucosa and muscularis mucosae to   involve with mucosa

    Localized, NOS
   
    Adventitia and/or soft tissue invaded
    Esophagus described as fixed
    Invasion into adventitia with invasion of/through mucosa
    Invasion of adjacent structures

**Cervical esophagus:**
 
    Carina
    Carotid artery
    Cervical vertebraâ¬
    Hypopharynx
    Jugular vein
      Larynx
      Thyroid gland 
    Subclavian artery
    Trachea
    
**Thoracic/middle esophagus:**

    Pericardium

**Abdominal/lower esophagus:**

    Diaphragm fixed

**Intrathoracic, upper or mid-portion, esophagus:**

    Blood vessel(s), major:
      Aorta 
      Azygos vein
      Pulmonary artery/vein 
      Vena cava 
    Diaphragm 
    Main stem bronchus 
    Trachea 

**Intrathoracic, lower portion (abdominal), esophagus:**

    Blood vessel(s), major: 
      Aorta 
      Gastric artery/vein
      Vena cava
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary site
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 5 cm but not more than 10 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 10 cm in greatest dimension
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No clinical evaluation of primary tumor
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
